intro: Kyrstenia koelliifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
